title: Edge on Demand: Greg Hardy, Tom Brady & Awkwardness
text:
Story Created: Oct 7, 2015 at 11:50 PM EDT Story Updated: Oct 7, 2015 at 11:50 PM EDT 
Dallas Cowboys defensive end Greg Hardy is at it again, saying all the wrong things as he prepares to hit the field Sunday in his first game of the season against the New England Patriots. 
Speaking to the media Wednesday, Hardy commented on quarterback Tom Brady saying, " You seen his wife? I hope she comes to the game. I hope her sister comes to the game." 
Hardy, who just finished serving a four-game suspension for a domestic violence incident in which he allegedly assaulted his then-girlfriend, threatened to kill her and then threw her onto a futon full of loaded firearms, also made an unfortunate reference to weapons: 
"I hope I come out guns blazing. I'm full of excitement and full of juice." 
And that brings us to our Question of the Night: Does Greg Hardy need to grow up?
